texts.definition: Quests that can only be taken in the endgame phase of a game, and are designed to provide challenges and rewards relevant to this phase.
markups: <style="Definition">Quests that can only be taken in the endgame phase of a game, and are designed to provide challenges and rewards relevant to this phase.</style>

Some games have <style="Link"><link="endgame">Endgame</link></style> phases and some of these can continue as long as players find interesting activities to do in the games. <style="CurrentLink">Endgame Quests</style> are quests specifically designed to support players in having such activities in these phases.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/World%20of%20Warcraft">World of Warcraft</link></style> allows players that have reached the highest character level to continue progressing with that character through completing <style="CurrentLink">Endgame Quests</style> that can give equipment or reputation. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Skyrim">Skyrim</link></style> in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Elder%20Scrolls%20series">Elder Scrolls series</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Final%20Fantasy%20VIII">Final Fantasy VIII</link></style> in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Final%20Fantasy%20series">Final Fantasy series</link></style> are single-player games with <style="CurrentLink">Endgame Quests</style>.

Designing <style="CurrentLink">Endgame Quests</style> are like designing other <style="Link"><link="quests">Quests</link></style> except that they should make sense to have in the <style="Link"><link="endgame">Endgame</link></style> phase. This may mean that they should not connect to main story lines in a game since these may already be finished. Further, they may have to take into account that players may already have reached caps for certain types of development since the <style="Link"><link="endgame">Endgame</link></style> might be defined by this, as for example reaching the maximum <style="Link"><link="character-levels">Character Level</link></style> signifies in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/World%20of%20Warcraft">World of Warcraft</link></style>. The two most common ways of addressing the development issue is to allow players <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> in the form of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Game-Based%20Social%20Statuses">Game-Based Social Statuses</link></style> or more powerful <style="Link"><link="armor">Armor</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="tools">Tools</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="weapons">Weapons</link></style> that can't be acquired before one has reached the <style="Link"><link="endgame">Endgame</link></style> phase.

<style="CurrentLink">Endgame Quests</style> are nearly always designed to provide <style="Link"><link="challenging-gameplay">Challenging Gameplay</link></style> since <style="CurrentLink">Endgame Quests</style> take place when players have had sufficient time to learn a game as well as have been able to develop <style="Link"><link="characters">Characters</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="abstract-player-constructs">Abstract Player Constructs</link></style>.

In games with <style="Link"><link="endgame">Endgame</link></style> phases, they typically occur after the main narration has been told. For this reason, <style="CurrentLink">Endgame Quests</style> are typically not <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Narration%20Patterns">Narration Patterns</link></style> having effect on the whole story line or the <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game World</link></style> as a whole. They may of course have localized narration.

<style="CurrentLink">Endgame Quests</style> are <style="Link"><link="quests">Quests</link></style> that provide <style="Link"><link="optional-goals">Optional Goals</link></style> for players that have reached <style="Link"><link="endgame">Endgame</link></style> phases or completed <style="Link"><link="main-goals">Main Goals</link></style>. They are examples of gameplay content made available through <style="Link"><link="unlocking">Unlocking</link></style>, in this case due to reaching an <style="Link"><link="endgame">Endgame</link></style> phase.
